Description: The Taj Mahal an iconic symbol of love is a white marble mausoleum built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
Rajasthan Amer Fort  also known as Amber Fort  is a majestic fort situated on a hilltop and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape and city.
India Gate is a war memorial dedicated to soldiers who died in World War I and stands as a symbol of India's unity and sacrifice.
The Gateway of India is an iconic arch monument built during the British Raj and is a popular tourist spot and gathering place in Mumbai.
The Ganges River holds immense religious significance for Hindus and witnessing its rituals and ceremonies along the ghats is a unique experience.
RajasthanCity Palace  a splendid palace complex  showcases the rich history and culture of Udaipur with its intricate architecture and stunning views
West Bengal Victoria Memorial Victoria Memorial  is an architectural marvel and museum housing a vast collection of historical artifacts.
Rajasthan Jaisalmer Fort  also known as Sonar Quila  is a golden-hued fort rising from the Thar Desert  offering panoramic views of the city and desert.
Fort Kochi  with its colonial buildings  Chinese fishing nets  and vibrant art scene  is a charming coastal area steeped in history and culture.
Marine Drive is a picturesque promenade along the Arabian Sea  offering stunning views of the ocean and the city skyline.
The Elephanta Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring ancient rock-cut caves dedicated to Lord Shiva

Place Name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (formerly Prince of Wales Museum)
Description: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya is a renowned museum showcasing art  and cultural exhibits from India and abroad.
Juhu Beach is a popular seaside destination known for its sandy shores  lively atmosphere  and vibrant food stalls.
Siddhivinayak Temple is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha  attracting devotees and visitors from all over the world.
Sanjay Gandhi National Park is a sprawling wildlife sanctuary offering opportunities for nature walks  safaris  attracting devotees and visitors from all over the world.
The Bandra-Worli Sea Link is an architectural marvel and a cable-stayed bridge connecting Bandra and Worli  offering stunning views of the sea.
Jahangir Palace is one of the top examples of Mughal Architecture and was used mainly by the Rajput wives of Akbar
Guru ka Tal is a historical Sikh pilgrimage place dedicated to the memory of ninth Guru Sri Guru Tegh Bahudar Ji.
Jama Mosque was built by Jahanara Begum, the eldest daughter of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, during the latter's reign. It is the principal mosque in the city of Agra
Sprawling over 119 acres of land in Sikandra, Akbar's Tomb stands out with its unique architecture combining red sandstone and white marble. The scenic garden surrounding it only adds to its beauty
Built by Shah Jahan, this structure is no less than a shining pearl when sunshine strikes its surface. It was built between the years 1648 to 1654.
A small fort city near Agra, this place was founded as the Mughal capital by Akbar. This ghost-town now houses unique buildings depicting a blend of Islamic, Hindu and Christian architecture.
Chini Ka Rauza distinguishes itself from other Mughal monuments through its distinct Persian architectural style. It’s believed to be the only building in India in Persian architecture.
This five-storey building has been built without a foundation and is known for its exceptional ventilation, which is also the reason behind its name

A stunning blend of Mughal and Rajput architecture, the palace is a magnificent landmark of the city. It continues to be the home of the last ruling royal family who stay in a private section of the palace.
Perched atop a ridge in the Aravalli Hills, Nahargarh Fort serves as a striking northern backdrop to the Jaipur city.
Meaning ‘Water Palace’, this captivating marvel overlooking the Nahargarh Hills is located in the middle of the Man Sagar Lake, and was constructed as a hunting lodge for the king.
Nestled in the heart of Rajasthan's capital, Jaipur, Birla Mandir, or Laxmi Narayan Temple, is a breathtaking architectural wonder.
Situated in the Ram Niwas Garden of Jaipur, the Albert Hall Museum is the oldest museum in Rajasthan
Located on the outskirts of the regal city of Jaipur, Galtaji Temple is a prehistoric Hindu pilgrimage site.
Qutub Minar comprises five distinct stories, each marked by a projecting balcony. While the first three stories are red sandstone, the last two are marble and sandstone.
Fantastic site to visit - unimaginable architechture, great theme show, diaorama and I max presentation.
This tomb, built in 1570, is of particular cultural significance as it was the first garden-tomb on the Indian subcontinent
The India Gate, built in 1931 and designed by Sir Edwin Lutyens, was inspired by the Arc de Triomphe.
An oasis in an otherwise crowded, dusty city, Lodi Gardens is the perfect place to spend a relaxing afternoon admiring nature.
This architectural wonder looks like an enormous lotus blossom, reminiscent of the Sydney Opera House. Too bad the interior isn't even worth a look.
Mahatma Gandhi's home while in Delhi and the site of his assassination.
The Dhamekha stupa and other imposing structures adorn this holy site where Buddha first preached his message
This ghat is also a starting point for boating rides and one can come here to enjoy early-morning yoga sessions and devotional music
It is a brick structure in red colour with a water body-Durga kund in the temple complex.
Sankat Mochan Hanuman Temple is a Hindu temple in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, India and is dedicated to the Hindu God Hanuman.
The temple stands on the western bank of the holy river Ganga, and is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, the holiest of Shivatemples.
Manikarnika Ghat is one of the oldest ghats in Varanasi and has been accorded the highest position among other ghats by the holy scriptures in Hinduism.
Ruchika Art Gallery allows visitors to pick up a paintbrush during artistic workshops in addition to presenting locally manufactured creative works.
Built on the banks of Lake Pichola, the City Palace in Udaipur is considered to be the largest royal complex in Rajasthan
The oldest and one of the largest lakes of the city, the Lake Pichola observes lakhs of tourists because of its tranquillity and beauty
Located just on the outskirts of the city of Udaipur, perched atop a hill, Sajjangarh Palace is a former royal residence belonging to the Mewar dynasty
Dharohar Dance Show is the main highlight of Bagore ki Haveli which is a colourful dance performance by the traditional folk artists and dancers
Jag Mandir Palace (or ‘The Lake Garden Palace’), is a glorious palace located on the southern island of Lake Pichola in Udaipur, Rajasthan.
Eklingji Temple is dedicated to the Lord Shiva of the Hindu religion and its brilliant architecture drives several tourists here every year.
Jagdish Temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu, also known as Lord Laxmi Narayan and is reputed for being the most significant temple in the entire city of Udaipur.
Belur Math in Kolkata is the headquarters of the Ramakrishna Math and Mission. Sprawling over forty acres of land on the west bank of the Hooghly River
An iconic landmark of Kolkata, Howrah Bridge is a massive steel bridge constructed over the Hooghly River
Birla planetarium is the largest planetarium in Asia and the second largest in the world! Situated in the city of joy - Kolkata
The finest collection of contemporary paintings, sacred relics of Buddha, Egyptian mummies and ancient sculptures.
Marble Palace Mansion has  art collection of masterpieces by Reuben and paintings by various renowned international artists such as Reynolds, Van Gogh and Rembrandt.
The Eden Gardens is a beautiful, well-maintained cricket stadium located in Kolkata's B. B. D. Bagh area, near State Secretariat and Calcutta High Court
The Tanot Mata Temple holds a unique distinction as it miraculously escaped damage even as the neighboring areas were heavily bombarded
Indian army has developed this place like a open Museum where destroyed pakistani tanks lying in sand .
Temples dedicated to the Jain Tirthankaras are considered some of the most important Jain temples in India.
The architecture of Gadsisar lake was simply magnificent with the carved verandahs and halls.
Wonderfully sculpted cenotaphs and chhatris of former rulers are the special attraction of Bada Bagh.
Sonee Art Gallery inside JAISALMER Fort is a collection of inspirational art portraying the True Heart of the people of Jaisalmer and the Deep Desert from which They have come.
Kothari's Patwa Haveli has been turned into a museum famous for its  architecture, interiors, and artefacts depicting the lifestyle
Built during the 1500s, Santa Cruz is one of the eight Basilicas in India and the second oldest Diocese of the country.
Built around Lake Kochi, the scenic Island is named after the former Viceroy Lord Willingdon. Home to Kochi naval base, it also serves as a link between Kochi and other international ports.
Developed by the Portuguese, Vypeen Island offers a delightful combination of lovely beaches, backwaters, light houses, and an array of restaurants and hotels.
This legendary seaport used to trade everything from spices to valuable stones millennia ago and now is home to India’s largest heritage conservation project.
The biggest hypermarket in the nation, a 2,500-seater food court, 6 cafes and 11 fine dining restaurants.
Jew Town situated at Mattancherry in Fort Kochi is famous for its antique shopping avenues
Kashi displays changing exhibitions of local artists in a creatively restored Dutch heritage house, attached to one of Kerala's most fabulous cafes.
